name: slaaaaabs
text: Just like Teen Wolf

name: cracklewater
text:
Nice Pete wears tube socks and tank tops during a murder AND NOTHING ELSE.

Thee muft make yon comment yearly and without fail, if thou wouldst keep the apple harveft bountiful.

name: 1000hz
text: Visitor wins the championship.

name: spinynorman
text:
Anyone notice his eyes get bigger and bigger throughout this arc?

He's got pinholes at the start and then at the end he has the black glass beads the size of doorknobs.

What. The. Fuck.

Perhaps he is seeing reality though a darkening glass in which the world is barren and broken and there is naught but suffering along the gray road.

name: boredom_man
text: All mirroring the approach of Karin's soul as she moves closer and closer to her Divine vision

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Quote:
spinynorman: Anyone notice his eyes get bigger and bigger throughout this arc?

He's got pinholes at the start and then at the end he has the black glass beads the size of doorknobs.

That is common when a person who is normally disinterested begins talking about the thing they love.

name: raticus
text:
Visual aid:

[IMGS OFF]

... would be a sick avatar.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Ack! You're really dilatin' there, Bob! Any bigger'n, an ole baby gonna pop right out!

...

This is throwing me right into a mystical conundrum. Because it is well-known that the eyes do in fact dilate when the person is thinking or talking about one they love.
And it is also a known fact that at the moment of death, the pupils dilate....and fixate.

name: dusty
text: It's a nice thought that they may be related, but I think they are both just because the mind is not on the present reality, in one case because it is immersed in their affection, the other because it has vanished into oblivion.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Don't underrate oblivion. Love is oblivion, just spelled a little different, bro.
like, biolovin .

name: thereminhero
text: I begrudgingly confess that Nice Pete does not have a bad ass.

name: overmedicated
text: Indeed, firm.

text: nice pete wearing a jersey only draws attention to the complete lack of pants.

text:
Dagnabbit, every time I'd read this strip in the past it seemed he was wearing... I don't know, some sort of lycra arrangement. In my mind's eye, there wasn't even a hint of crack.
Can't. Not. See.

text: He takes care of himself. he is not of low ass.

text: I can recite this strip by heart. This is something I am proud of.

text: Me too, only I derive no pride whatsoever from this fact ):

text: Me too, and I recited it to my friends while we were drunk, and I'm no longer sure where their opinions of me stand.

text:
As far as strips to recite drunkenly go, this is a pretty good one.

Also, epicurus can recite all strips verbatim at any time, so his shame is understandeable.

text: A comment left by zapatos was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by glorify, ESwrathwright, campincarl, Lawdog)

name: doctorother
text: I want to see this strip animated for the sole reason that is does not require it, nor would it make use of much animation.  Just Nice Pete standing there in squeaky shoes.  And then an abrupt cut to a van door swinging shut. It's just so perfect.

text: Pete being bottomless is a totally sweet touch

name: choosebro

name: origotoshi

name: digdugz
text: One of my favorite strips.

name: spinynorman
text: This strip is the one that made me start reading Achewood. I remember it specifically, because my brain makes crazy things like this sometimes. The sense of identification was overwhelming and disturbing.

name: fancyrat
text: That is precisely how Achewood works.

text: That should not make you feel cold. Seeing a barracuda in the water FROM IN the water -- that should make you feel cold. Seeing the barracuda from deck of the boat should only make you feel that the person who keeps reminding you that you them money is not standing close enough to rail. Perhaps you could help.

text: Every strip in this entire arc is goddamn beautiful.

text: I spent about an hour trying to chop the text from this one in order to fit it into an MSN avatar. I also tend to sen this link to people and then they never speak to me again.

name: korukyu
text:
I called my roommate over to read this.

Now she keeps sneaking suspicious looks at me over her book. Am I the Visiting Team or the Home Team? I guess it depends on which one of us falls asleep first...

name: epicurus
text: ...In which Korukyu assumes that she and her roomate have an unspoken agreement to murder whichever of them should fall asleep first.

name: rosie
text: NP's lack of pants gives a scary sex-offender vibe to his crimes. Also the silhouette of the other player running feebly at the opposite end of the court, trying in vain to escape.

text: I often send this link to co-workers.

text:
Yeah panel 2 is definitely a nice touch, it's sort of an insane, focused tension before he speaks.

I would like to know what happened in Nice Petes life that made him psychotic, as we only get hints from the events in his childhood. Maybe one day we'll get to find out?

name: afkpuz
text:
I thought it was more of Nice Pete taking his time to process the question.

As to the second part, I'd blame it on West Virginia but I'm from VA proper so that'd be unfair.

name: boredom_man
text: I am from Atlanta, and do not blame anything on West Virginians as they will murder me if I try.

name: rachel
text:
oh no I grew Pubics

Daddy is gonna kill me for sure

name: shades
text: The perfect strip. Achewood is so dependent on the story arcs that it is hard to show individuals strips to friends and actually have them appreciate it. However, this strip is such genius that EVERYONE who sees it cracks up.

text: The second panel is where Nice Pete decides it's all right to open up to Pat and that it's all right not kill him

text:
I showed this to a gothish girl in study hall back in high school. Her exact reply was:

"If I tilt my head, will my brain fall out? It seems to have shrunk. "

Bitch.

text: I almost gave this a lame on account of how that girl is so lame!

name: stuart
text: That girl is so lame .

text: There's never any need to show anything to a gothish girl, except the finger in the middle of your hand.

name: tekende
text: Lamest girl is ever beink.

name: bixschmix
text: I also almost reflexively lamed you, on account of your lame-ass goth friend. You won't catch me going there, not for a million bucks.

name: nicolae

text: Pat KNOWS what it's like to kill someone. That's how he met Pete in the first place.

text: Yeah, but that was accidentally. And that's probably nothing more special than hitting one of those wastepaper-basket basketball-nets.

I hate Nice Pete.

But it is a good hate.

name: kingsleymc
text:
"And I am the winner."

Classic.

name: professoryes
text:
"I put the other player's body into the back of my van, and I am the winner."

Out of context, that is the chronicled representation of the rules of House as told by a domineering five year-old girl.

name: drskradley
text: The score is 0-1 at the end of the 4th quarter.  Pete is the visitor, the dead guy is home.

name: jugglegod
text:
One of my favorite strips ever. I think this one also sums up Nice Pete's character perfectly.

Also, possibly the creepiest/most awesome thing about Nice Pete is his hair and mustache (You know, aside from the lack of pants during murder). Perfection.

name: naughtybyn8ture
text: Nice Pete wears tube socks and tank tops during a murder AND NOTHING ELSE

name: choosebro
text:
Question:

What is Pete? He doesn't have a tail, so I don't think he is a cat or a dog. What kind of a animal, stuff toy, whatever, is he?

name: choosebro
text:
Answer:

He's a cat, according to the alt-text of this strip:

http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua47R6wN

Magic.

name: rowboat
text: I can't believe that in three weeks no one has lamed that question. I mean, I don't find it particularly lame, and I'm not going to. But with some of the lame-happy people here it just seems amazing! Oh, and of course he's a cat.

name: straw
text: I give you a chubby for your candidness.

name: bixschmix
text: What I can't believe is that two people lamed this poor guy innocently inquiring about the lack of laming! His question in an of itself was not lame, my dear Achewood compadres! To be fair, asking if Nice Pete was a dog was a dumb question! So, thus, I chubby you, as restitution for the wrongs that have been wrought.

name: rowboat
text: Actually, only one of those should count. The other is from ovenface, who spends all of her free time in life systematically laming every comment I make. Yes. I occasionally check. For that, I guess I deserve the lames anyway.

name: heccibiggs
text:
How do you check who lames you? I need to settle some scores.

Okay, I don't actually care that much, but I am curious.

name: rowboat
text:
Oh, I don't even feel right about telling you. I kind of wish I'd never found out, sometimes. But it does make things more interesting, and it's useful to know who really, really hates you so you don't end up being ignorantly civil toward said hater at a later date, so:

Just under the "post a comment" box (the one just under the strip) there's an option to hide comments with a certain amount of lames. Change it to 1 lame and save it. Then scroll back down and find yourself (your avatar and comment will no longer appear, so just look for your name) and assetbar will tell you all the dirty little names of the folks who thought what you said was the worst thing ever.

Enjoy responsibly.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh wow. That's genius.

name: bourbonsamurai
text:
This is terrible knowledge you have unleashed, rowboat. It is not meant for the masses.

I will go hide in my bunker, awaiting the internet-based apocalypse.

Rowboat is pretty clearly merely the unwitting accomplice though.

I think heccibiggs is probably going to be the assetbar anti-christ

name: rowboat
text: Whoa, don't blame us! Me, I'm just passin' it down the line. Besides, it's sort of important. In the least important way possible.

name: heccibiggs
text: ...[IMGS OFF]

name: rowboat
text: What have I DONE?!

name: bourbonsamurai
text: There is no room for you in my bunker. Sorry.

name: spinynorman
text:
Oh, man. That is pretty goddamn sweet. Sometimes things get lamed and you're honestly like, "Wait, what?"

How clever.

name: fineoakstructure
text: I had to look at this about 7 times before I figured out what you'd done.  I'm not really sure if that makes it subtlety and bad execution, but I'm leaning towards the former.

name: tekende
text: It took me a while too.

speaking of bad execution:

"subtlety or bad execution

name: fineoakstructure

"

fuck me i can't even blame this on assetbar

This is so full of dry humour it's just great.

name: salvagebar
text: Rated FIVE for having four seconds left on the shot clock. Nice Pete is such a badass, he managed to get fouled, kill the other player, stuff his body in a van, and return to the court, all within TWENTY SECONDS. AND he sunk at least one of his penalty shots.

name: milo
text: "Nice Pete wears tube socks and tank tops during a murder AND NOTHING ELSE"

text: I've read this strip so many times and it just never gets old. I am ordering a signed copy right now.

text: No one would chase him. Or fight with him. There's method to his madness.
